Name: Shabti of Sethos I
Description: The Museums of Brussels posesses four shabtis of the pharaoh Sethos I. Only one (E.8386) is made of blue faience, the other three (E.5551, E.5563A-B) are wood. This example in wood shows the  mummiform king wearing a long wig. The arms are crossed on the chest and the hands hold two hoes. The hieroglyphic text, much deteriorated, is taken from Chapter 6 of the Book of the Dead. The figurine was originally painted black.
